text: Q10.| If f(n) = O(g(n)), then which of the following statement is/are true? 1./f(n) + g(n) = O[fog(n)]; where ‘0’ represents function composition. 2. f(n) + g(n) = O[gof(n)]; where ‘0’ represents function composition. 3. f(n).g(n) = O[f(n).g()] (a) 1 only (b) 2 & 3 only (c) 3 only (d) None of these
